( Carnage: I shall post my new characters profile in a later post.)

** It had been months earlier that he had located the final destination of 
his older half-brother, searching through classified filed late into the 
nights just to find out more about him.
He had known little about his older brother while he had grown, seeing 
little glimpses of him before Von had finally disappeared all together from 
his life.
But he couldn�t blame Von for leaving once he was old enough to; their 
mother had never loved him and ignored him all of his life. In fact, he felt 
sorry for his older brother. His life had never been fair from the 
beginning.
Bu8t now he was searching for Von, wanting to see him and perhaps get to 
know the never brother he knew nothing about.
Vons last know location: Prehistoric Earth.

But this young man searching for his older half-brother had his own name, 
one, which his mother said suited him well. His name was Vlad.
The pampered out of the two offspring.
But Vlad had other reasons besides a family reunion in order to find his 
brother. Their mother had passed away less then 6 months prior to the 
present and, surprisingly, left every piece of property to Von.
So, now Vlad, was left to locate his brother and supposedly inform him of 
everything which had happened. If Von was still alive. And if he was�Vlad 
was sure he wouldn�t be for much longer.
From what his mother had told him, Von was weak in mind and both spirit�a 
very easy target if he wasn�t careful.
There had been no further reports on him after he had disappeared on 
Prehistoric Earth and only the Matrix knew if he was alive. And if he 
wasn�t, Vlad snickered, everything would go to himself!

Vlads personally owner Predacon StarHopper closed in on the time deplaced 
dimensional rift, which led to Prehistoric Earth, thinking of his actions 
towards his brother if indeed he was alive.
Vlad couldn�t just keep what his mother had legally signs off as Vons, he 
didn�t want to get in slag with the law.
But if he had proof that Von was dead, if he was, then everything was his by 
the law. However, if Von was indeed alive then he would have to resort to 
another way of getting what he wanted. As in returning with Vons death 
certificate.
But for legal matters he wouldn�t do it himself, no. He would pay another or 
even a few others to snuff out Von for him.
Vlad knew that there were other bots on earth, he just needed to offer the 
right price to get what he wanted. As in ionized Energon. A perfect drug or 
a very expensive and profitable  selling pieces.

The rift came closer and Vlad shifted the craft to autopilot, sitting back 
in the chair of the cockpit.
All he had to do was ride it out until he entered earth�s solar system, 
land, find the nearest Predacon faction, pay his assassin, and sit back to 
wait until he either brought back Vons badly decomposed body to prove he had 
died, or freshly severed head�.
Vlad licked his lips as he leaned his head on his hand, being a Predacon was 
wonderful.
A large dog/wolf-like creature resting it�s huge head on the armrest, 
whining. Vlad knew it had never liked space travel, having the mutt ever 
since he couldn�t remember.

The StarHopper entered slowly into the rift, eventually disappearing into 
its depths. Knocking out all of the ships systems as well as Vlad and his 
animal.
The edge of the rift shimmering for a moment before settling, leaving it to 
look as if no ship had ever passed through.
Leaving nothing but the silence of space.
The hunt was on!**

(20 min later)

** The rift opened on the other side, spewing out the Predacon StarHopper, 
the ship turning on its axes and sparking.
The force from being ejected from the rift sent the small ship sailing 
towards Earth, shaking it nearly to pieces before there was a violent shake 
as it struck the atmosphere.
Throwing the unconscious Vlad against the window as the ship�s outer hull 
turned into a large fireball, finally breaking the atmosphere and beginning 
its decent towards the ocean. The Alliance base less then 2 clicks away.**
